contentrichtext.text: The '''Worshipful Company of Paviors''' is one of the [[Livery Company|Livery Companies]] of the [[City of London]]. The Paviors were formed at some point prior to 1276; they were responsible for the paving and maintenance of London's streets. It received a [[Royal Charter]] in 1672. The Company is no longer a trade association for, and a regulator of, London's road constructors, instead acting as a charitable institution; for example, it has sponsored a road making display at [[Amberley Working Museum]]. The Paviors' Company ranks fifty-sixth in the [[order of precedence]] for Livery Companies. Its motto is ''God Can Raise to Abraham Children of Stone''. ==External links== * [http://www.paviors.org.uk/ The Paviors' Company] {{Livery Companies in the City of London}} [[Category:Livery companies|Paviors]]
